overview_of_class: This is the first of a three-quarter sequence intended primarily for science and engineering majors and premedical students. PHYSICS 135-1 covers classical mechanics. Topics covered include: Newton's Laws of motion, projectiles, relative motion, circular motion and centripetal force, conservation of energy, momentum and angular momentum, center of mass, moment of inertia, and Newton's Law of gravity.
name: General Physics
title: WCAS PHYSICS 135-1-01 General Physics
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Co-requisite: Students must also register for PHYSICS 136-1. Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the first of a three-quarter sequence intended primarily for science and engineering majors and premedical students. PHYSICS 135-1 covers classical mechanics. Topics covered include: Newton's Laws of motion, projectiles, relative motion, circular motion and centripetal force, conservation of energy, momentum and angular momentum, center of mass, moment of inertia, and Newton's Law of gravity.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Math 220-0, Math 224-0, and concurrent registration in Math 230-0, or the equivalent. Prior physics is not necessary but is helpful. Concurrent registration in Phyx 136-1 (physics lab) is required.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three 50 minute lectures per week, and a weekly quiz section (50 min.)

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Quizzes, two midterms, and final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Fundamentals of Physics, Extended 10th edition, by Halliday, Resnick, and Walker

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Fundamentals of Physics 10th Edition Extended by Jearl Walker scientific calculator

subject: PHYSICS
